plantas.descrip: Peashooters are highly versatile plant combatants. They provide plenty of explosive damage and are effective against smaller targets.

skins.extra: Azure Pea gets angry when mistaken for an Ice or a Sad Peashooter.

skins.obtencion: Purchasing Deluxe Edition Upgrade or Origin Access Premier subscription
skins.extra: Never underestimate the supreme power of Chick Pea. NEVER!

skins.obtencion: Garden Party prize map completion reward. Also purchasable from Rux for 200,000 Coins (Nintendo Switch Edition only)
skins.extra: Ironically, it's a crime against humanity to look this good.

skins.obtencion: Garden Party prize map, costs 20 Prize Bulbs. Also purchasable from Rux for 200,000 Coins (Nintendo Switch Edition only)
skins.extra: In the future, he protects, and also serves on the weekends for extra cash--because crime doesn't pay.
Will joust for honor, for justice, for honor again--preferably between nine and five.
Contrary to the popular belief, Sappy Pea is not emotional. This costume is used by Elusive Foe Amber Gemma.
Sea Pea can't actually breathe underwater, which is too bad. He loves it down there!

sets.obtencion: Three separate items in Valenbrainz prize map, costs 21 Prize Bulbs in total

sets.extra: This set is used by Dave Manor NPC Beau Tanic.

sets.obtencion: Purchasable from Rux for 550 Rainbow Stars
sets.extra: Step into the garden and face him in vegetal combat!
This set's name is a portmanteau of 'Pea' and 'Egyptology.'

hats.obtencion: 100% character challenge completion reward during Feastivus

hats.extra: This Hat is used by Quest Giver Tumbleweed Ted. Its name is a reference to the Law Pea Peashooter variant.

hats.obtencion: 100% character challenge completion reward during Fall Food Fight
Snow Day prize map, costs 7 Prize Bulbs
Purchasable from Rux for 750 Rainbow Stars. Purchasable from Rux for 150,000 Coins (Nintendo Switch Edition only)
hats.extra: Its name is a pun on 'skunk' and 'punk rocker.'
This hat is a reference to Stinky the Snail.

plantas.descrip: Close range attacker that can snare and slow opponents and can Burrow underground to instantly vanquish opponents. Don't let them see you coming!

skins.obtencion: Feastivus prize map, costs 10 Prize Bulbs
skins.extra: Nobody knows what's going to happen to him in the summer. Its name is a reference to the Yeti, which is also known as the Abominable Snowman. It could also be somewhat of a reference to the Yeti Chomper variant from Plants vs. Zombies: Garden Warfare 2.

skins.obtencion: Fall Festival prize map, costs 10 Prize Bulbs
skins.extra: He really has nothing to be blue about, he's got great friends, racquetball on Tuesdays, and a nice 401(k). Its description is pun on its name and appearance. It has a striking resemblance to Power Chomper's appearance in Plants vs. Zombies: Garden Warfare 2.

skins.obtencion: Summer DayZ prize map, cost 10 Prize Bulbs
skins.extra: Neither valiant, nor heroic, he's just a chomper stuck in metal armor.

skins.obtencion: Purchasable from Rux for 1,000 Rainbow Stars. Purchasable from Rux for 200,000 Coins (Nintendo Switch Edition only)
skins.extra: He's all thrills, frills, and bite.
With fur so soft everyone wants to know his brand of conditioner. This Costume is used by Battle Leader Teddy.

skins.obtencion: Purchasable from Rux for 550 Rainbow Stars
skins.extra: Truly man's best friend-if a best friend licks your face after eating a burrito from a landfill. This Costume's internal name is 'Dirty Dog.'

skins.obtencion: Purchasable from Rux for 550 Rainbow Stars
skins.extra: He wanted to make a drastic change in his life. He got eggsactly what he asked for.

skins.obtencion: Valenbrainz prize map, costs 20 Prize Bulbs
skins.extra: He takes great pride in cutting and styling his own hair. This costume is a pink recolor of the Cuddle Chomper costume.
Olive Chomper likes sitcoms, satires and sailboats. This is commonly used by Chomper Champions. This Costume is used for the Mount Steep NPC Wes Tern. It is also used for the Glutonous Chomper.
Don't call him a zebra. He only responds to Z-Chomp.
